subject: RE: [junit] How can I get Junit Test to run in parallel threads?
msgSnippet: ... I m surprised to hear this now Mike, since you and I exchanged a few notes when the product was released in July. Looking back at the emails we exchanged,
messageBody:
Mike Clark wrote:
> As a member of this community, and the open source community in general,
> it got me to thinking about the licenses I use for the stuff I build.
> Anything I craft in the future may just be licensed such that
> commercial redistribution rights are only available by writing me.
> Non-commercial redistribution, and its use in the development of
> non-commercial products, will be freely granted. In other words, if I
> contribute to this community in good faith, commercial vendors have to
> ask before leveraging my wares.
>
> I guess I expected that type of communication would happen naturally
> inside of a community. It won't be the first time I've been naive, nor
> the last. Live and learn.
>

I'm surprised to hear this now Mike, since you and I exchanged a few notes
when the product was released in July. Looking back at the emails we
exchanged, your only real comment about it then was, "I would be interested
to hear anything you hear from your EJU customers about JUnitPerf." I also
made the comment to you that "I hope it wasn't too presumptuous of us to
include it", which you never responded to.

Anyway, I would be happy to remove JUnitPerf from the distribution if it
bothers you being there, as it is not at all core to the product. If you
read the documentation you will see that it is described in terms of 'here's
something else you can do with your tests if you add in a few JUnitPerf
decorators'. I haven't gotten any feedback from any of our customers that
they are actually using JUnitPerf in conjunction with Enhanced JUnit.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com
